title: Drawing, "Four Studies of Young Bamboo and Vines, South America", May 1857
inscribed:
Recto: Inscribed in graphite with figures at left:   2 Water / 3 Rich verona Brown , Yel ochre brown / 4 beautiful light silvery green / 5 Strong yellow green; and at top right:   Opposite Guayaquil May.

Verso:  Inscribed in graphite at top:   young bamboos very / delicate foliage; and at bottom:   trees.
description:
Recto:  Horizontal broad view of a river bank with bushes, trees, and a house, and a sketch of the upper part of a walking man shown from the back at top, and a view of a similar river bank seen leading into the background at bottom right.

Verso: Horizontal view of a group of trees, branches of bamboos on top row, and a vine hanging from a scaffold on bottom row, with lines separating the four motifs.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Four Studies of Young Bamboo and Vines, South America", May 1857.
May 1857. Graphite on paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-200.
